data.title: When in fullscreen mode, it should be possible to easily click on a tab
data.body:
The fullscreen mode must be active (<kbd>F11</kbd>), see this screenshot:

![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1285361/7552615/f8a561b4-f6be-11e4-963f-02efbb5f0efd.png)

The cursor is at the "uppermost pixel" of the screen, and the inactive tab is not hovered. However, if I lower it down a bit, then the tab becomes hovered.

I think that, when the fullscreen mode is active, the tab should be hovered even when the cursor is at the uppermost pixel (other apps behave this way, like gnome-terminal).

data.title: Document public properties in addition to methods
data.body:
Currently, only public methods are documented in the API, but many classes (`Point`, for example) have de facto public properties as well (e.g. `row`, `column`). These public properties should be documented for public consumption.

/cc @atom/feedback

data.title: View > Increase Font Size doesn't show keybinding
data.body:
![screenshot 2015-05-09 15 49 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/823545/7551762/239ec7fe-f663-11e4-8d6c-01703dd48090.png)

Atom 0.197.0-a79a8fa in safe mode, OS X 10.10.3

Can anyone on Linux or Windows confirm?

data.title: Disable middle mouse paste
data.body: I keep accidentally pasting stuff by clicking the middle mouse button, so I wanted an option to disable it. This adds a new setting to the `editor` schema that toggles middle mouse paste.

data.title: All atom terminals haven't sudo ability in ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
Hello!

Firstly, I thank this is an `term2` package error: https://github.com/webBoxio/atom-term2/issues/118 but after little research I've understood that this is an all atom terminal plugins error, so `term` or `quantum-shell` plugins raise this error too.

When I try to implement any `sudo` command, I get this:

``` bash
sudo: effective uid is not 0, is /usr/bin/sudo on a file system with the 'nosuid' option set or an NFS file system without root privileges?
```

How can I avoid this error? What's going wrong with my atom?

data.title: PHP files are no more colorized since 0.198
data.body:

Seems weird since 0.198 said "Fixed an issue where certain PHP files would not be colorized"

I tried to change the theme, to update again, to reload 0.197. Nothing works, any idea ?

data.title: Cursor position messed up on reload when using antialiased font.
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Put in css: `-webkit-font-smoothing: subpixel-antialiased !important;`
2. Open a file
3. reload editor with `ctrl+alt+cmd+L` or close and open the same project.
4. Should cause the below effect (note: I'm clicking at the end of line each time before typing)
   :
   ![demo](https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/2J291S1C1K0C1D3a432D/Screen%20Recording%202015-05-07%20at%2008.33%20PM.gif)
   Also here's a more [high quality demo](http://cl.ly/0e390i1J3d0r). Notice how the cursor is not rendering at the end of the line where I'm clicking, although when I type, the text is correctly being inserted where it should. 

Side note: while investigating this I inspected the editor buffer's displayBuffer, and notice that it has a property called `charWidthsByScope`. I compared some of the `charWidths` before and after the reload and noticed that after reload they are all the same, whereas before the reload they had different values: ![screnshot](https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/2Q08350N3m2P1V022k26/Image%202015-05-07%20at%208.38.00%20PM.png) (top is after reload, bottom is before reload).

Also if you know how I can manually force a 'recalculation' of these values that would be great, as users of my syntax theme are having this issue and I'd like to fix it by forcing the recalculation of these values.

data.title: Is version 0.198.0 for OS X with wrong node version?
data.body:
when I install  omnisharp-atom,I get this error:
npm WARN engine omnisharp-node-client@1.1.4: wanted: {"node":">=0.12.0","iojs":">=1.0.0","atom":">=0.194.0"} (current: {"node":"0.10.35","npm":"2.5.1"})

Then I test atom node version:
/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/bin/node --version
v0.10.35

data.title: child process spawned with child_process.fork cannot spawn an electron-shell
The overlay decorator misplaced to be on the right bottom corner of the given range.
:racehorse: Avoid repeated array allocation in ::getDecorations
data.body:
Some good low-hanging :cherries:. Screen updates:

Before:
![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/7524833/9777b4d4-f4b9-11e4-9d8e-cede4539645a.png)
300 ms / 3 fps. Spikes at the bottom are GC.

After:
![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/7524860/ba3ddc64-f4b9-11e4-9c57-39490230d596.png)
20 ms / 50 fps. No GC.

data.body:
I'm getting the following error when loading my package right after update to `Version 0.198.0 (0.198.0)`.

``` js
Cannot read property 'getDefaultRepresentation' of undefined in /Users/francoislaberge/.atom/packages/jibo-atom/package.json

Stack Trace:

TypeError: Cannot read property 'getDefaultRepresentation' of undefined
    at Function.module.exports.Package.normalizeMetadata (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:53:17)
    at Function.module.exports.Package.loadMetadata (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:84:12)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.loadPackage (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:343:38)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.loadPackages (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:324:14)
    at Atom.module.exports.Atom.startEditorWindow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom.js:620:21)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-bootstrap.js:12:8)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-bootstrap.js:23:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:452:26)
    at Object.loadFile [as .js] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/babel.js:162:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:347:32)
  at /Users/francoislaberge/.atom/packages/jibo-atom/package.json:1:1
```

data.title: Find remaining performance bottlenecks for large files
data.body:
This list is a work in progress.
- Memory Usage:
  - [x] Marker snapshots (https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/71)
  - [x] Tokenized lines eat tons of memory (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6757)
- Scrolling:
  - [x] Garbage collection during `DisplayBuffer::getDecorations` (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6694)
- Typing:
  - Generally
    - [ ] Updating symbol store index takes ~4ms
  - With an active find and replace query:
    - [x] `MarkerManager::handleBufferChange` (https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/58)
    - [x] `Marker::notifyObservers` (#7023)
    - [x] Find-and-replace recreates all markers, not just those affected by change (https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/394)
    - [ ] `TextEditorPresenter::updateDecorations()`
- Switching tabs:
  - [x] `Marker::destroy > TextEditorPresenter::observeDecoration > CompositeDisposable::remove`. (https://github.com/atom/event-kit/issues/7)
- Initially loading files
  - [x] Screen lines are computed twice (#6777)
  - [x] We query for folds on every line when building the display buffer instead of batching (#6879)
  - [x] Creating placeholder tokenized lines blocks UI thread for multiple seconds 
  - [ ] Creating initial symbol store index blocks UI thread for multiple seconds
- Moving the cursor
  - [x] Bracket matcher takes a long time scanning for the matching bracket (https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/64)
  - [x] Move forward by word hangs in huge files (https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/72)
  - [x] Bracket matcher still seems to be hanging in huge files (https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/72)
- Rendering
  - [x] Beyond about 700k lines, lines are no longer rendered (#6733)
  - [x] Beyond about 700k lines, gutter is no longer rendered (#7101)

Other ideas:
- [x] Disable tokenization above a certain size (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7130)
- [x] Disable soft wrap above a certain size (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7130)

data.title: Auto indent not working for open curly brackets in next line
Make 'atom' command w/ no args reopen previous windows
data.body: Closes #6464

data.title: Indent rendering - soft wrap
data.body:
Atom 0.198.0
Linux mint 17.1

This is how looks like the same file in sublime and atom.
I open the file using `atom .zshrc --save`

![fortat](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2009698/7522728/aab775a4-f4bc-11e4-86ea-cb10a9a9f920.png)

data.title: Move selected line up and down in Linux
data.body:
'ctrl-shift-up': 'editor:move-line-up'
'ctrl-shift-down': 'editor:move-line-down'
For some reason this is default for OSX but not for Linux, while Sublime's default configuration for this keymap in Linux and Windows is indeed moving the line up or down

data.title: :arrow_up: fs-plus@2.8.0
Move selected line up and down in linux default conf
data.body:
'ctrl-shift-up': 'editor:move-line-up'
  'ctrl-shift-down': 'editor:move-line-down'
For some reason this is default for OSX but not for Linux, while Sublime's default configuration for this keymap in Linux and Windows is indeed moving the line up or down
